intro: Dombeya punctata var. crenata, commonly known as the serrated dombeya, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for garden cultivation. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
